title: AB 1685
content: The people of the State of California enact the following. Section 43016 of the Health and Safety Code is amended. Section 43016 of the Health and Safety Code establishes civil penalties for violations of emission control laws, with a maximum penalty of $37,500 per violation. Violations related to portable fuel containers or small off-road engines may incur a penalty of up to $500 per unit. Manufacturers or distributors may be required to pay the penalty and ensure compliance with emission control laws to continue selling regulated products in the state. The state board adjusts maximum penalties for inflation based on the California Consumer Price Index, exempt from the Administrative Procedure Act. Penalties collected are deposited in the Air Pollution Control Fund. Section 43151 of the Health and Safety Code prohibits the sale, import, or use of uncertified motor vehicles or engines in California. The article does not apply to a vehicle acquired to replace a damaged or stolen vehicle, or transferred by inheritance or court decree. It also does not apply to vehicles sold after a specific legislative session if registered before that date. This chapter does not apply to motor vehicles with a certificate of conformity under the federal Clean Air Act, originally registered in another state by a resident who moves to this state and provides proof of previous registration. This provision takes effect 180 days after regulations are adopted for certifying new direct import vehicles. Section 43154 of the Health and Safety Code is amended to impose civil penalties for violations of emission control laws. The penalty for individuals can be up to $37,500 per violation, while dealers may face penalties of up to $10,000 per violation. Compliance with emission control laws may be required for manufacturers and distributors to continue selling vehicles in the state. The state board will adjust maximum penalties for inflation based on the California Consumer Price Index, exempt from the Administrative Procedure Act. Any action to recover a penalty under this section shall be brought in the name of the people of the State of California in the superior court of the county where the violation occurred, by the Attorney General on behalf of the state board, or by the district attorney, county attorney, or city attorney. Penalties adjudged by the court shall be deposited in the Air Pollution Control Fund. Section 43211 of the Health and Safety Code is amended. Section 43211 of the Health and Safety Code is amended to require new motor vehicles in California to meet emission standards set by the state board. Manufacturers selling vehicles that fail to meet these standards may face civil penalties up to $37,500 per vehicle. Additionally, penalties for not meeting zero-emission vehicle credit requirements are capped at $5,000 per credit. Penalties collected will be deposited into the Air Pollution Control Fund. The state board will adjust maximum penalties for inflation based on the California Consumer Price Index, exempt from the Administrative Procedure Act. Any penalties collected will be deposited into the General Fund. Section 43212 of the Health and Safety Code is amended. Section 43212 of the Health and Safety Code is amended to impose a civil penalty of up to $37,500 for each vehicle that does not comply with emission standards. Penalties collected will be deposited into the General Fund. The state board can adjust the maximum penalty for inflation based on the California Consumer Price Index. Any penalty collected will go into the Air Pollution Control Fund. The board has the authority to order a manufacturer to bring their vehicles into compliance with certified emissions configurations. Compliance may be required for continued vehicle sales in the state.
